name: Oil and Cotton Collage Kit
description:
A great gift for all your creative friends and family. Each unique kit is handmade by us with tender loving care and includes ephemera collected through the years from vintage photos to handwritten notes and Grandma's collection of Duckwall's dimestore greeting cards. 

Collage kits are 6"x8" and include several scraps, cut shapes, notecard and envelope.

Add a glue stick and scissors to complete your road trip/rainy day/restaurant survival kit.

name: Crayon Rocks
description:
Developed by Barbara Lee, an art teacher in California, Crayon Rocks are all natural soy wax crayons made from USA grown soybeans and colored with mineral pigments.

The colors are vibrant and can be layered to make beautifully textured art work. They were designed to strengthen the tripod grip muscles, preparing fingers and hands for handwriting. The shape allows small fingers to color in large, wide strokes creating pictures rich in color.

Used by occupational therapists to develop fine motor skills.
Large bag contains 16 colors
Small bag contains 8 colors

name: Ephrem's Original Bottle Cutting Kit
description:
We use this etching tool in our bottle cutting workshops. Created by Ephrem Gelfman in the 1970s, this tool is easy to use, functional to create an even etched line, creating a clean break when heated and cooled. 

Turn your trash into treasures, making stylish glassware and vases out of your favorite bottles. Grandad's Christmas list only ever consisted of two things: a six pack of beer and a carton of Pall Malls. Something about that just seemed impersonal and I always ended up giving him 'thoughtful' things instead. If only I'd know about Ephrem's kit. He gets his beer, I make him recycle, everyone's happy! It's a new Boxing Day tradition just waiting to happen.

name: RxArt Coloring Book
description:
Between the Lines: Volume III. 

RxArt is a non-profit organization dedicated to placing original fine art in patient, procedure and examination rooms of healthcare facilities. Our mission is to improve otherwise sterile environments through contemporary art, promote healing, and inspire hope in patients, families and staff.

Artists of all ages will be delighted with Between the Lines: Volume III, which features the work of 60 celebrated contemporary artists. Everyone is free to add his or her personal touches to the pages. The book is 120 pages long and features four pages of full-color stickers by Rob Pruitt and Trenton Doyle Hancock. Between the Lines: Volume III is available for sale on our website, in museums and book stores in the United States and internationally.

name: Wee Wooden Cup
description:
This lovely little cup helps the youngest future artists develop motor skills by tripod gripping the handle and directing a delicious drink to the mouth. It also makes a great little cave, finger spinner, hat, and whatever your child might imagine. 

My mother-in-law comes from a family of Waldorf educators, and she gave our daughter this cup when she was first born. She played with it at about six months and started taking little sips of water and breastmilk right away. How exciting! Such independence! Her motor skills are amazing, and I attribute it to this cup.

Handmade in California by a very nice man named William Bluhm. Made from Western Pine with a natural finish of beeswax & organic flaxseed oil.
